title: A4050 road
text:
The A4050 road connects <a href="Barry%2C%20Vale%20of%20Glamorgan">Barry, Vale of Glamorgan</a> with <a href="Culverhouse%20Cross">Culverhouse Cross</a> on the outskirts of <a href="Cardiff">Cardiff</a>, <a href="Wales">Wales</a>. It is approximately long, and is the key link road between the M4 motorway and <a href="Cardiff%20International%20Airport">Cardiff International Airport</a>.
<a href="Wenvoe">Wenvoe</a> village lies along the road. In 2008 the <a href="Welsh%20Assembly">Welsh Assembly</a> allocated £576,000 to road resurfacing and improvement, which as of 2012 was still ongoing. One area given specific attention is the area around <a href="Pencoedtre">Pencoedtre</a> between Waycock Cross and Barry as housing development and a new crematorium has been created in recent times.
At Culverhouse Cross, the A4050 connects to the <a href="A48%20road">A48</a> and the <a href="A4232%20road">A4232</a>. The A48 links with <a href="Cowbridge">Cowbridge</a> and to <a href="Cowbridge%20Road%20West">Cowbridge Road West</a> which connects the western Cardiff district of <a href="Ely%2C%20Cardiff">Ely</a> to Canton and the city centre. The A4232 links with the <a href="M4%20motorway">M4</a> at junction 33 and <a href="Cardiff%20Bay">Cardiff Bay</a>.
